name: EPAM
description: I am in charge of migrating applications made in Angular v13 to v18. Refactoring to improve performance, reusability, and good practices on private libraries and applications. Coding review. Adding unit, integration, and e2e testing, with Jest, Testing library for Angular, also Storybooks with play functions. Azure CICD, Jira. Implementing signals.
highlights: Health insurance industry experience with complex applications
Migrated Angular applications from v13 to v18
Improved performance and code reusability
Implemented comprehensive testing strategies
Jenkins CI/CD pipeline integration
Testing with Jest, Testing Library and Storybook

name: Byte Factory
description: As Senior Frontend Engineer, I was responsible for guiding the technical direction of the team and ensuring code quality, scalability, and performance across the application. I mentored junior and mid developers, conducted code reviews, and led architectural decisions. My work involved deep refactoring of core frontend layers—including components, services, directives, and forms—while implementing secure authentication and authorization mechanisms. The stack included Angular 16, TypeScript, RxJS, NgRx, and integration with APIs and BFFs. I also collaborated closely on testing strategies and CI/CD using Docker and Azure, within a high-demand retail environment.
highlights: Retail industry experience with high-demand application
Led the frontend team and mentored junior developers
Refactored core architecture for performance and maintainability
Implemented secure authentication and role-based authorization
Drove testing strategy with unit and integration coverage
Worked with modern DevOps stack: Docker, GitLab, Azure CI/CD

name: Double Nines
description: As Frontend Lead, I spearheaded the development of a custom component library built from Figma designs and powered by Kendo UI, fully documented with Storybook and covered by comprehensive testing. I led a distributed frontend team and drove the evolution of the application from Angular 13 to v15. A key part of my role was designing and implementing a scalable micro frontends architecture using Webpack Module Federation and NgRx for state management. I also integrated secure authentication with Okta and implemented fine-grained authorization using guards and structural directives. This work supported complex business workflows in the logistics industry, all deployed on AWS infrastructure. Additionally, I mentored junior engineers, fostering growth and code quality across the team.
highlights: Transportation industry experience
Built and released a reusable UI library from Figma using Kendo and Storybook
Designed and implemented micro frontend architecture with Module Federation
Integrated Okta authentication and custom role-based authorization
Led Angular migration efforts (v13 to v15) and coached junior developers
Delivered scalable solutions for the logistics domain on AWS

name: Aquiva Labs
description: At Aquiva Labs, I contributed to a large-scale insurance platform built with Angular v8, Material, and NgRx. My role focused on stabilizing the application by identifying and resolving bugs, improving code quality, and ensuring reliability through robust unit testing. I also developed new features aligned with evolving business needs, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced agile environment.
highlights: House insurance industry experience
Improved platform stability through critical bug fixes and testing
Delivered new features within a legacy Angular 8 codebase
Strengthened code quality with well-structured unit tests using Jasmine
Contributed to frontend efforts in a high-compliance insurance domain

name: Cognizant Softvision
description: As Frontend Lead at Cognizant Softvision, I guided the development of complex enterprise applications, including a human resources platform and a payments system. I led a team working with Angular 9+, Material, and NGXS for state management, and acted as the main code reviewer ensuring quality, consistency, and best practices. I also conducted Angular technical interviews to evaluate and onboard new talent. My responsibilities included developing scalable modules for user and payment management, implementing 3D elements with Three.js, and writing unit tests with Jasmine.
highlights: Human Resources and Online Payments industry experience
Led frontend architecture and team for two enterprise platforms
Acted as primary Angular code reviewer and technical interviewer
Developed features for user and payment management at scale
Integrated NGXS for structured state management
Ensured high test coverage and code quality with Jasmine

name: Globant
description: At Globant, I worked as a Frontend Engineer and Team Lead on multiple enterprise applications for clients like Ernst & Young, within the legal, contracts, and tax domain. Using Angular 8+ and Material, I led code reviews, mentored junior developers, and authored a comprehensive guide on clean code and best practices. I contributed to complex UI development, data visualization with D3.js, and end-to-end testing with Selenium. The projects followed Scrum and Kanban methodologies, and integrated tools like Azure DevOps, Jira, and REST APIs.
highlights: Legal, contracts, and tax industry experience
Led frontend efforts for high-profile client projects (Ernst & Young)
Authored internal clean code and best practices guide
Mentored junior developers and performed rigorous code reviews
Delivered UI features with Angular, SCSS, and D3.js
Built testing strategies with Jest (unit/integration) and Selenium (e2e)
